titleStmt.title: Maria Edgeworth Letters Project Workography
titleStmt.author: Meredith Hale
titleStmt.sponsor: Texas A & M University, University of Tennessee, Wake Forest University, Xavier University of Louisiana, Southern Methodist University

availability.licence: Distributed under a Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 (CC BY 4.0) Unported License

sourceDesc.p: The form of the titles shared are established by Wikidata or transcribed from the letters of Maria Edgeworth. Only first-edition texts are defined in the workography, except in special circumstances.

body.p: This is a workography that defines literary works associated with the Maria Edgeworth Letters project.

bibl.title: Account of the Life and Writings of William Robertson
Adelaide and Theodore, or Letters on Education

title.foreign: Adèle et Théodore, ou Lettres sur l'Education

bibl.title: The Adventures Of Hajji Baba Of Ispahan
A Father's Legacy to His Daughters

title.foreign: Don Alonzo; ou, L'Espagne; histoire contemporaine

bibl.title: American Journal of Science and Arts [alternatively known as Sillimans Journal]
The Ancient History of the Egyptians, Carthaginians, Assyrians, Babylonians, Medes and Persians, Macedonians and Grecians, translated from the French in seven volumes

title.foreign: Anecdotes Historiques, Militaires et Politiques de l'Europe

bibl.title: Annals of the Reign of King George the Third
Anne of Geierstein, or The Maiden of the Mist
Articles in Varieties in Monthly Magazine, February 1818
Unidentified work containing the stories of Pierre, Pierrette, and Marguerite, translated by Lucy Jane Edgeworth Robinson
The New Bath Guide: or, Memoirs of the B-R-D Family
Bertha's Journal During a Visit to Her Uncle in England
The British Review, and London Critical Journal
"The Burial of Sir John Moore after Corunna"
Cecila, Or, Memoirs of an Heiress
The Christmas Box: An Annual Present for Children

title.foreign: Des Circonstances Actuelles qui Peuvent Terminer la Révolution et des Principes qui Doivent Fonder la République en France

bibl.title: A Collection of the Miscellaneous Writings of Professor Frisbie
Conversations on Vegetable Physiology : Comprehending the Elements of Botany, with their Application to Agriculture
Cottage Dialogues Among the Irish Peasantry

author.persName: Established by Lord Bolingbroke and William Pulteney

bibl.title: A Dictionary of the English Language
The Drummer; or, The Haunted House. A Comedy.
Essay on Construction of Roads and Carriages
Evelina; or, The History of a Young Lady's Entrance Into the World
Fragments of Voyages and Travels, Including Anecdotes of a Naval Life
Frank: a Sequel to Frank in Early Lessons
Garry Owen; or, The Snow-Woman; and Poor Bob, the Chimney-Sweeper
Harrington, a Tale; and Ormond, a Tale
Harry and Lucy Concluded: Being the Last Part of Early Lessons
Hesiod: or, the Rise of Woman
History of the Conquest of Mexico, with a Preliminary View of the Ancient Mexican Civilization, and the Life of the Conqueror, Hernando Cortez
The History of Scotland, volume II
The Holy Bible: Newly Translated from the Original Hebrew, with Notes Critical and Explanatory
Horace in London: Consisting of Imitations of the First Two Books of the Odes of Horace
Julia de Roubigné, a Sentimental Novel. In a Series of Letters.
Karamania or a Brief Description of the South Coast of Asia-Minor and of 1818
The Last of the Mohicans: A Narrative of 1757
Letters and Journals of Lord Byron: with Notices of His Life, by Thomas Moore
The letters and works of Lady Mary Wortley Montagu Edited by her great-grandson Lord Wharncliffe
A Letter to the Dublin Society Relative to Experiments on Wheel Carriages
The Life of Lorenzo de' Medici, Called the Magnificent
The Life of Napoleon Buonaparte, Emperor of the French
The Literary Gazette and Journal of the Belles Lettres
Memoirs Of Count Lally: From His Embarking for the East Indies, as Commander in Chief of the French Forces in that Country, to His Being Sent Prisoner of War to England

title.foreign: Mémoire pour le comte de Lally, Lieutenant-Général des Armées du Roi, Grand-Croix de l'Ordre Royal & Militaire de Saint-Louis, ci-devant Colonel d'un Régiment Irlandois de son nom, Commissaire du Roi & Commandant en Chef dans l'Inde : contre Monsieur le Procureur-Général.

bibl.title: Memoirs of Richard Lovell Edgeworth, Esq Begun by Himself, and Concluded by His Daughter, Maria Edgeworth
Memoirs of the Court of Queen Elizabeth
Memoirs of the Life and Writings of Victor Alfieri
Memoirs of the Life of Dr. Darwin
Memoirs of the Life of Sir Walter Scott, Bart
Memoirs of the Life of William Collins, Esq., R. A.
Memoirs of the Abbe Edgeworth: Containing His Narrative of the Last Hours Of Louis XVI
Memoirs of the Life of Richard Brinsley Sheridan
Orlandino: A Story of Self Denial
The Parent's Assistant, Or, Stories for Children
The Pilot: A Tale of the Sea
The Pioneers, or the Sources of Susquehanna; a Descriptive Tale
The History of Rasselas, Prince of Abissinia
Reflections on the Subject of Emigration from Europe
Reminiscences: Written in 1788, for the Amusement of Miss Mary and Miss Agnes B***y: Lord Orford's Reminiscences
Rosamond: A Sequel to Early Lessons
Salmonia, or Days of Fly Fishing
A Series of Adventures in the Course of a Voyage up the Red Sea, on the coasts of Arabia and Egypt, and of a Route through the Desarts of Thebais, in the Year 1777
Sketches from Flemish Life, in Three Tales
Sketches of China; Partly during an Inland Journey of Four Months, between Peking, Nanking, and Canton; with Notices and Observations Relative to the Present War
The Spy: A Tale of Neutral Ground
Tales and Novels by Maria Edgeworth

title.foreign: Le Théâtre d'Éducation au XVIIIe Siècle

bibl.title: The History of Tom Jones, A Foundling
Tomorrow; or the Dangers of Delay
Travels in North America during the Years 1834, 1835 & 1836 : Including a Summer Residence with the Pawnee Tribe of Indians and a Visit to Cuba and the Azore Islands
View of the Evidences of Christianity
The Works of the British Poets
Rush's Residence at the Court of London
